com.jakubpetriska.gameengine.api

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jakubpetriska.gameengine.api.GameObject

  • public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an object. GameObject serves only as container for functionality. GameObject itself will not be displayed in final rendered content in any way.

    Functionality is added to GameObject using components. Components need to be subclasses of Component class and they can be added through GameObject's methods from scripts or in xml files defining initial scene layouts.

    GameObject can also be used to only hold children objects for manipulation.

    • Field Detail

      • tag

        public java.lang.String tag
        Tag of this object. Can be used to identify objects during collisions.

      • children

        public final java.util.List<GameObject> children
        Contains all GameObject's children.

        This list is unmodifiable, use appropriate GameObject instance methods to remove children.

        Adding children to this GameObject can be done through passing this object as parent into child GameObject's constructor or calling setParent(GameObject) on the child GameObject.

      • components

        public final java.util.List<Component> components
        Contains all GameObject's components.

        This list is unmodifiable, use appropriate GameObject instance methods to add or remove components.

      • transform

        public final Transform transform

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(Application application,
                  GameObject parent,
                  java.lang.String tag)
        Creates new GameObject.

        This constructor is meant for constructing top level GameObjects. Creating top level object from scripts is currently not supported. if you pass null as parent appropriate lifecycle methods will not be called on this object.

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(Application application,
                  GameObject parent)
        Creates new GameObject.

        This constructor is meant for constructing top level GameObjects. Creating top level object from scripts is currently not supported. if you pass null as parent appropriate lifecycle methods will not be called on this object.

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(GameObject parent,
                  java.lang.String tag)
        Creates new GameObject. Use this in your scripts.
        Parameters:
        parent - GameObject's parent. Can never be null.

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(GameObject parent)
        Creates new GameObject. Use this in your scripts.
        Parameters:
        parent - GameObject's parent. Can never be null.

    • Method Detail

      • getParent

        public GameObject getParent()
        Returns GameObject's parent GameObject.
        Returns:
        Parent GameObject of this GameObject.

      • setParent

        public void setParent(GameObject parent)
        Sets new parent to this GameObject and also removes it from children of previous parent.
        Parameters:
        parent - New parent GameObject.

      • removeChild

        public void removeChild(GameObject childObject)
        Removes childObject from children of this object if childObject is a child of this GameObject.

        After removing, childObject is no longer valid GameObject and cannot be used any further. Also no references to it should be kept.

        Parameters:
        childObject - Child GameObject to remove.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(Component component)
        Adds new Component to this GameObject.
        Parameters:
        component - Component to add.

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(Component component)
        Removes Component from this GameObject if it is it's component.
        Parameters:
        component - Component to remove.

      • getComponent

        public <T extends Component> T getComponent(java.lang.Class<T> componentClass)
        Returns the specific component of type T attached to this GameObject.

        In case there is more than one component of type T attached to this GameObject the first that could be found is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the component to be returned.
        Parameters:
        componentClass - Class of the requested component.
        Returns:
        The instance of T attached to this GameObject as component or null if no instance of T is attached to this GameObject.

      • getComponents

        public <T extends Component> void getComponents(java.lang.Class<T> componentsClass,
                                                java.util.List<T> resultList)
        Obtains all components of type T attached to this GameObject.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of the components to be returned.
        Parameters:
        componentsClass - Class of the requested components.
        resultList - List into which the requested components will be added.
